msDesc.head: Charters and statutes, etc., of London (‘liber memorandorum’), s. xiv 2/4

msContents.summary: A collection of various documents and memoranda relating to London. Almost all the contents are also found in the ‘Liber Horn’ compiled by Andrew Horn. At least as far as fol. 87r, the contents were originally numbered sequentially, but most of the numbers were later erased. The present manuscript is a sister volume to the London ‘Liber Memorandorum’, which contains almost exactly the same contents, marginalia and numbering, but ends incomplete in the ordinances of the fishmongers (fols. 69v-72v below). Most items are printed or calendared from other copies in Munimenta Gildhallæ Londoniensis, ed. H. T. Riley, Rolls Series (1859) and/or Calendar of letter-books preserved among the archives of the Corporation of the City of London at the Guildhall, ed. R. R. Sharpe (1899–1912).
msContents.textLang: Latin and Anglo-Norman, with a very little Middle English (fols. 46v, 56v-57r)

msItem.rubric: De restitucione Libertatis
msItem.note: Ordinance of 1298 regarding homicides, robbers etc., as cal. Letter-Bk. B, p. 215.

msItem.rubric: Quid abrocarii vini capient pro doleo
msItem.note: 1286, as cal. Letter-Bk. A, p. 164

msItem.rubric: Item de abrokariis vinorum
msItem.note: Writ of 1285, as cal. Letter-Bk. A, pp. 214–5.

msItem.rubric: Des maceons
Des seriauntz de Maceons
[added, 14th century De carectariis Loni sabuli vel Grauele
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.i.99(l. 21, ‘Et a totes solempnes festes’...)-100; cf. Letter-Bk. A, p. 184.

msItem.rubric: De non ponendo Midd’ ad firmam
msItem.note: 18 Oct. 1283, as cal. Letter-Bk. A, p. 206, names of aldermen not here given.

msItem.rubric: Quod in omnibus placitis terrarum sint duo homines feoffati
msItem.note: 18 Oct. 1283, as cal. Letter-Bk. A, p. 206.

msItem.rubric: Item in quarto hoc statutum de molendino de Braciatoribus
msItem.note: Ordinances concerning millers and fraudulent brewsters, as pr. Munimenta I.354–5; cf. Letter-Bk. A, p. 208.

msItem.rubric: De latitudine pannorum
msItem.note: French. As briefly cal. Letter-Bk. A, p. 212.

msItem.rubric: De recognicionibus factis Camerario
msItem.note: Memorandum that the chamberlain receives recognizances of debts, referring to Letter-Book A.

msItem.rubric: Carta teutonicorum id est Alemannorum
msItem.note: Letters patent of Edward I of inspeximus to the merchants of Germany in London, 18 Nov. 1281 (cal. CPR 1272–81, p. 485) followed by charter of Henry III, 1260 (Letter-Bk C, p. 41).

msItem.rubric: Composicio facta inter Ciues London’ et teutonicos
msItem.note: June, 1282, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 41.

msItem.rubric: De muragio London’
msItem.note: Writ of Edward I, n.d., differs from Letter-Bk. A, pp. 222–4.

msItem.rubric: (added) Alias carta de muragio
msItem.note: Writ of Edward I, 18 July 1276

msItem.rubric: Carta Coloniensium
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.i.66–7, but the regnal year here is 28.

msItem.rubric: Carta Alianore nuper Regine Anglie facta fratribus penitencie iesu christi
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta III.430–1.

msItem.rubric: Carta Regis Henrici facta Decano sancti Martini magni Lond’
msItem.note: 4 Feb. 1231, as pr. Munimenta II.ii.669–71

msItem.rubric: Carta Burg’ de Portesmeue
msItem.note: Charter of Richard I, 2 May 1194, as pr. Munimenta II.ii.655–6

msItem.rubric: Carta Oxon’
msItem.note: Charter of Henry III, 16 Feb. 1229, pr. Munimenta II.ii.672–3. Followed by a note that on 12 Jan. 1327 the burgesses of Oxford were prohibited from buying wine from ‘extraneis’ in the city of London, as recorded in the Black Book ‘alio signato cum littera A’, fol. 12.

msItem.rubric: Breve Burg’ de Duaco
msItem.note: Writ of Edward I, 1282, preceded by a note that the writ was presented to the mayor and others in the Guildhall by Walter Musard, burgess of Douay, on 29 Sept. 1282; as cal. Letter-Bk. B, p. 233.

msItem.rubric: Carta regis Edwardi de eisdem
msItem.note: Charter of Henry III, 1260, as cal. Letter-Bk. B, pp. 233–4, here dated 41 Henry III.

msItem.rubric: Carta Ciuium Oxon’
msItem.note: Charter-inspeximus of Henry III to Exeter (‘Oxon’’ corrected only once in this text to ‘Exon’’), 24 March 1237, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 64, pr. (from inspeximus of Edward I) Munimenta II.ii.667–9.

msItem.rubric: Carta Exon’
msItem.note: Charter-inspeximus of Edward I, 4 May 1300, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 240, pr. Munimenta II.ii.667–9.

msItem.rubric: De bladar’
msItem.note: 24 Feb. 1300 (here misdated as 28 Edward II); as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 58

msItem.rubric: Carta honoris Walyngford
msItem.note: Charter inspeximus of Henry III, 12 Jan. 1267, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 59, pr. Foedera i.471, etc.

msItem.rubric: Conuencio inter Ciues London’ et Mercatores de Amias Corbye et de nele
msItem.note: 1237; as as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 66, pr. Munimenta II.i.64–66.

msItem.incipit: Memorandum quod in xlviij folio eiusdem libri nigri inuenitur quod Rex per breve suum
msItem.note: Notes of items in the ‘liber niger’, fols. 48 and 49

msItem.rubric: Returnum cuiuslibet brevis de prisonibus extra lib’ ducend’
msItem.note: Return to a writ of 1300, as cal. Letter-Bk. C. pp. 69–70.

msItem.rubric: Walebrok. Et de pontibus eius iuxta murum.
msItem.note: Summary of inquisition of 8 July 1300, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 70

msItem.rubric: Item de Walebrok
msItem.note: Summary of inquisition of 12 July 1300, cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 70

msItem.rubric: De custodibus Pontium
msItem.note: Summary of agreement of 20 July 1300, cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 72

msItem.rubric: Carta fratrum predicatorum
msItem.note: Charter of Edward I, 10 June 1276, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 71–2.

msItem.rubric: Carta proris sancte Trinitatis
msItem.note: Charter of Henry I, as pr. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 73–4.

msItem.rubric: De lormerariis
msItem.note: Ordinances of 45 Henry III, as pr. Munimenta II.i.78–80.
Marginal note that the original sealed chirograph was burned in the Guildhall, St Faith, 14 Edw. II.

msItem.rubric: Pena forist
msItem.incipit: In eodem libro fol. Lj scribitur quod foristallarius attinctus debet
msItem.note: Perhaps cf. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 76–7.

msItem.rubric: De Richardo de Refham
msItem.note: Summary of writ of 14 June 1300, cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 77–8.
Note of election of wardens of the lorimers in 1313, as recorded on the last folio of a red book of memoranda in the Guildhall (Letter-Bk. D, p. 316).

msItem.rubric: De compoto Camerariorum
msItem.note: Summary of ordinance of 14 Sept. 1300, cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 78.

msItem.rubric: Breve pro mercatoribus Burdegal’
msItem.note: Writ of 29 August 1300, with return, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 80.

msItem.rubric: Carta de libertate de Rading’ regis Henrici tercii patris regis Edwardi nunc
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.ii.671. Followed by a note that the charter was read and enforced on 28 March 1318 following a complaint by the mayor of Reading, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 82.

msItem.rubric: Iudicium pro nautis
Salarium mensuratorum bladi et carianc’ in Ripa Regine
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 86–7.

msItem.rubric: Salarium mensuratorum bladi et carianc’ in Ripa Regine
msItem.note: Inquisition of 1300, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 87.

msItem.rubric: Capitula dicenda pistoribus in halimoto suo
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta I.356–8 and II.i.104–5.

msItem.rubric: De constitucionibus prouisis et observandis in Civitate Lond’ In Itinere Iusticiorum anno Regis Henrici xxviijo in rotulo Hugonis de Waltham
msItem.note: As pr. London Eyre of 1244, ed. Helena M Chew and Martin Weinbaum (London, 1970), pp. 82–113, no. 235

Followed (fol. 14r) by memoranda that this constitution was ordered to be observed in the parliament of 1302 (partly as National Archives, SC 9/11, item 15, as pr. in Parliament Rolls of Medieval England)

msItem.rubric: Carta regis Henrici de eligendo Maiorem
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.i.45–6

msItem.rubric: Irrotulantur in Itinere regis Henrici apud Turrim London’ coram Huberto de Burgo et sociis suis Iustic‘ annis .v.to et .x.o dicti Regis Henrici
msItem.note: ‘Quaestiones itineris’, as pr. Munimenta I.62–71.

msItem.rubric: De ponder’
msItem.note: As pr. Statutes of the Realm, I. 204.

msItem.rubric: De mensura strictorum de rotis ad carect’
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 88–9, pr. Munimenta II.i.85

msItem.rubric: Quod vicecomites inueniant clericos ad scribendum placita hustengalia
msItem.note: Ordinance of 1302, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 106, partly pr. Munimenta I.402, II.i.88

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio de iudicio reddendo in hustengo et de testamentis admittendis
msItem.note: Ordinance of 1302, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 108.

msItem.rubric: Placita terre tenta in husteng’ London’ die lune proxima post festum sancti Edmundi Regis videlicet .xxij. die Nouembris anno regni regis Edwardi .vj.to
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 108, pr. Munimenta I.403–4, II.i.89

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio de rotulis vic’ de intrusionibus
msItem.note: Friday after St Martin, 1304, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 108.

msItem.rubric: De officio vic’ supplendo non obstante resistencia
Item de probacione testamenti
msItem.note: Two ordinances of 1259, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 108.

msItem.rubric: De contempnentibus sequestrum
Quod non gaudeant summonicionibus
Quod appreciatores habeant cum petens ea haberent nolit
msItem.note: Three ordinances of 1305, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 109.

msItem.rubric: Ordinaciones de clauibus de Neugate et Coketto
msItem.note: 1305, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 110.

msItem.rubric: Pro hominibus de Alemannia quiet’ apud Bisshopesg’
msItem.note: 1305, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 111.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio renouata pro Cordewaners
msItem.note: 1303, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 126, pr. Memorials II.i.83–4. French.

msItem.rubric: De statera vt remaneat in equali
msItem.note: Writ of 16 Nov. 1305, as briefly cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 129.

msItem.rubric: De iuramento officii recordacionis
msItem.note: 1304, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 132–3.

msItem.rubric: Composicio inter Ciues Wynton’ et London’
msItem.note: 1304, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 133–4.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio poletrie et piscis
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 134, pr. Munimenta II.i.82–3.

msItem.rubric: Quod quid non eat obuiam piscibus et empcione piscium
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 134, pr. Munimenta II.I.117–20.

msItem.rubric: AdmissioAmissio libertatis carnificum
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 148–9.

msItem.rubric: Preceptum factum est piscenariis de vico pontis
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 149.

msItem.rubric: Returnum brevis regis quod statutum Wynton’ non pt in Ciuitate Lond’ in omnibus articulis obseruari
msItem.note: Writ of 7 Dec. 1306, and return, as very briefly cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 153.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio fustariorum
msItem.note: French. As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 167–8, pr. Munimenta II.i.80.

msItem.rubric: Seruicia et libertates Roberti fiz Wauter in London’
msItem.note: French. As pr. Munimenta II.i.147–51.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio facta de modo ponderandi per balanc’
msItem.note: 1309, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 209–10.

msItem.rubric: De recognitere desponsata
msItem.incipit: Post hec in folio proximo sequenti inuenietur quod recognicio stabit mulieris recognicionem facientis
msItem.note: Probably refers to Letter-Bk. D, p. 239.

msItem.rubric: De non fullonando pannos ad moldeninum sub pena
msItem.note: 21 Dec. 1310, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 239–40, pr. Munimenta I, app. II.

msItem.rubric: Finis Godefridi de Loueneye
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. D p. 240, pr. Munimenta III.431.

msItem.rubric: Turnarii
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. D p. 240, pr. Munimenta III.432.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio de vendicione vinorum tempore Richardi de Refham
msItem.note: 15 Jan. 1311, as cal. Letter-Bk. D p. 249, pr. Delpit, Collection Generale des Documents Français qui se trouvent en Angleterre, pp. 44–45.

msItem.rubric: Iuramentum megucerorum
De equis infra Ciuitate vel suburbia non excoriandis
msItem.note: 1311, as cal. Letter-Bk. D p. 258, pr. Munimenta III.432–3.

msItem.rubric: De capelariis
msItem.note: Three ordinances of temp. Henry III and 1311, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 271–3.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio facta de placeis ad le stokkis
msItem.note: 12 March 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 281–2.

msItem.rubric: Premunicio facta mercatoribus alienigenis quod non morentur nec teneant bona sua deuendita vltra xl dies
Quod alienigene non teneant bona sua deuendita ultra xl. dies
msItem.note: 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 282–3.

msItem.rubric: De alienigeneis in libertate admittend’
De communi sigillo custodiendo
msItem.note: 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, p. 283, first three articles only.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio de clericis et seruientibus Ciuitatis
msItem.note: 1310, as briefly cal. Letter-Bk. D, p. 284.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacione super assessione et collectione talliagiorum in Ciuitate ne quis alibi taxetur quam in Warda vbi manet
msItem.note: 1311, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 285–6.

msItem.rubric: De ponderacione magne balancie
msItem.note: 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 296–7.

msItem.rubric: De custuma ponderatoris magne balancie
msItem.incipit: Item in folio habentur ordinaciones promulgandas per totam civitatem et sunt valde longe et scribuntur ante

msItem.rubric: Carta de libertatibus ville de Andoure
msItem.note: Charter of Henry III (1228), and related proceedings of 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 299–300.

msItem.rubric: Memoranda de allegacionibus factis per maiorem et ciues London’ coram consilio domini regis Edwardi filius regis Edwardi quod non debent talliari
msItem.note: Proceedings of 1313, ending with writ of 16 Dec. 1314, as cal. Letter-Bk. D, pp. 305–7 and as pr. Munimenta III.433–7.

msItem.rubric: Breve domini regis directum Taxatorum de comitatu Oxon’ ne assiderent Ciues London’ inter eos ad tallagium
msItem.note: 13 Feb. 1313, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 10, pr. Munimenta I.428.

msItem.rubric: Peticio exhibita Maiori et Aldermannis per Comunitatem
msItem.note: 1312, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, pp. 12–14, the final item (John Simeon) not given here.

msItem.rubric: Placitum coram Iustic’ domini Regis de Banco placitum in quo allocata fuit libertas Ciuitatis
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. E, pp. 22–23.

msItem.rubric: Breve domini Regis pro pace conseruanda secundum articulos statuti Wynt’
msItem.note: Writ, 13 Apr. 1314, and subsequent proclamation, as briefly cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 25, cf. CPR 1313–17, p. 107.

msItem.rubric: Breve domini Regis vicecomitis London’ absentibus et ad scaccariam Regis presentand’
msItem.note: 26 Sept. 1313, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 25.

msItem.rubric: Placita coram domini Rege apud Westm’ de termino sancti Michaelis anno regni regis Edwardi filii Edwardi octauo
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 39, pr. Munimenta I.298–300.

msItem.rubric: Breve Regis Edwardi filii Regis Edwardi quod nullus interfit eleccioni Maioris aut vic’ nisi ad hoc summonitus fuerit
msItem.note: Writ, 4 July 1315, and proclamation, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 53 = Letter-Bk. D, pp. 24–6.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio bladar’
msItem.note: French and Latin. As cal. Letter-Bk. E, pp. 56–7.

msItem.rubric: Querela pottariorum
msItem.note: French. As cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 67, cf. Memorials, p. 118.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio peperariorum de Sopereslane
msItem.note: French. As cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 67, cf. Memorials, p. 120.

msItem.rubric: Allocacio libertatis ville Gippewyci et transcriptum libertatum eiusdem ville
msItem.note: 1318, reciting charter-inspeximus of Edward II (30 May 1317), as cal. Letter-Bk. E, pp. 84–5.

msItem.rubric: De ordinacione prima Cordewaniroum et hic retro in capitulo lxxxxvj est antiqa eorum ordinacio
msItem.note: 56 Henry III, as pr. Munimenta I.441–5.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio pictorum
msItem.note: French. 11 Edward I. Unprinted (?).

msItem.rubric: Consuetudines veteres de Ripa Regine
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta I.445–8.

msItem.rubric: Sacramentum vicecomitis London’
msItem.note: Cf. Munimenta I.307–8.

msItem.rubric: Nouum statutum Ebor’ anno R. Edwardi .xij.mo
msItem.note: 12 Edw. II, as pr. Statutes of the Realm i.177

msItem.rubric: Breve domini regis de prisis quod confirmat statutum primum W. et ordinaciones de prisis cessandis
msItem.note: Writ of 10 Apr. 1316 as cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 63.

msItem.rubric: Breve domini regis de poletria et animalibus
msItem.note: Writ of 14 March 1315, cf. Letter-Bk. E, p. 44, but here addressed to sheriffs only.

msItem.rubric: Breve domini regis de reclamatione poletrie per ipsum Regem et consilium
msItem.note: Writ attested 20 Feb. 1316; cf. Letter-Bk. E, p. 44 n. 1

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio de serviciis in domibus prelatorum et aliorum magnatum de ystrionibus
msItem.note: French; 6 August 1315; as cal. CCR 1313–18, p. 306.

msItem.rubric: De trona Ciuitatis emendata
msItem.note: 1313, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, pp. 19–20.

msItem.rubric: Prosecucio facta tempore domini Johannis de Gisorcio Maior London’ per Hugonem de Waltham
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.i.137–47; cf. Letter-Bk. E, p. 21.

msItem.rubric: De diuersis purpresturis tangentibus vic’ London’
msItem.note: As briefly cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 21.

msItem.rubric: Ordinacio Wyndrawerorium
msItem.note: 30 Edward I; cf. Letter-Bk. C, p. 111, here omitting names.

msItem.title: Laws of Oleron
msItem.note: The text in the Liber Memorandorum was collated (siglum M) in the edition by T. Twiss, The Black Book of the Admiralty, Rolls Series (1873), II. 210–241.
Followed by a memorandum on the location of Oleron, as pr. Twiss, I.lx n.
Transcripts of royal charters to London.

msItem.rubric: Carta Regis Willelmi primi anno domini millesimo .lxvij.o
msItem.note: English and Latin versions, dated 1314, as pr. Munimenta II.i.246–7.
Henry I (W. de G. Birch, The historical charters and constitutional documents of the city of London (1884), no. 3)
Henry II (Birch, no. 4)
Richard I, 1194 (Birch, no. 5)
John, 5 July 1199 (Birch, no. 9)
Henry III, 18 August 1227 (Birch, no. 16)
Henry III, 18 Feb. 1227 (Birch, no. 14)
Henry III, 26 March 1268 (Birch, no. 20)
Letters patent of Henry III, 22 Dec. 1226 (Patent Rolls Henry III, 1225–1232, p. 104; not in Birch)
Followed by a memorandum of 24 Oct. 1321 relating to fines for non-appearance when summoned.
Henry III, 18 Feb. 1227 (Birch, no. 13)
Followed by a note that a similar charter was granted by King John, from which the compiler deduces (‘intelligo’) that the first mayor was elected in John's reign .

msItem.title: Leges Edwardi Confessoris
msItem.incipit: Post adquisitionem Anglie per Willelmum Ducem Norm’ Idem Rex Willelmus anno regni sui quarto
msItem.note: Followed (fol. 52r) by note: leges et consuetudines per ipsum Willelmum et per successores suos ordinate in hoc libro inuenies.
Charter of Henry I (Birch, no. 3, same text as fol. 47r above)
Charter of Henry II (Birch, no. 4, as fol. 47r-v above)

msItem.rubric: Hic incipiunt questiones quas Iustic’ itinerantes ad Turrim London’ proposuerunt Ciuibus London’ super placitis Corone
msItem.note: Largely as pr. Munimenta I.62–71; same text as fols. 14v-16r above.

msItem.rubric: Corrodium de ponte
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta III.449–53.

msItem.rubric: Extenta manerii de Leuesham quod vocatur le Bruge Hous
msItem.note: n.d.

msItem.rubric: Nomina Anglicana vsitata in cartis antiquorum regum Angl’
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta III.453–6. English and French.

msItem.rubric: Isodorus ethimologiarum libro xvo capitulo xvo
msItem.explicit: hoc est per unum diem naturalem
msItem.note: Begins as XV.xv.2 but continues regarding ‘stadium’; followed by notes on measures according to English custom (pollex, ulna, etc.); and on the cubit according to Alfraganus; followed in turn by notes on the height of gutters and the length of ‘teyse’, as in the red book and transcribed later in the present book.

msItem.rubric: De quo warranto
Proclamacio super quo Warranto
msItem.note: Writ, n.d., enclosed proclamation.
Note on procedure when a ‘foreigner’ is vouched to warranty.
As pr. Munimenta II.i.177.
Writ of Edward I, 10 June 1281, enclosing a corrected article of the Statute of Gloucester.

msItem.rubric: Breve perpetratum super libertate pro viduis
msItem.note: Writ of Edward I or Edward II (1279 or 1314) regarding widows' contribution to tallage.
Letter of papal legate Ottobonus on the same subject.
1268, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 37.

msItem.rubric: De legibus regis Aeluredi sumptis de veteri testamento
msItem.note: 4 lines, cf. Exodus 22.22–24, Deut. 27.19

msItem.rubric: Carta Regis Henrici viduis London’ concessa anno Regis Henrici Lij.o
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 36–7, pr. Foedera I.i.475.

msItem.rubric: Concessio xxti.ml. marcas et ml.xlviij. libras
msItem.note: 1299, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 37–8 [fol. xxviii b].

msItem.rubric: Breve Regis pro libertatibus Ciuium Wynt’
msItem.note: 1299, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 40–1 (fol. xxx).

msItem.rubric: Confirmacio libertatum Ciuibus London’ facta per dominum Regem Edwardum filium Edwardi anno regni sui xijo
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta II.i.255–68.
Numerous marginal notes.

msItem.rubric: De conseruacione pacis Regis
msItem.note: Ordinances of Edward I for the government of the city while in the king's hand, as pr. Munimenta I. 280–97. French.

msItem.rubric: Consuetudines piscenariorum pontis et veteris piscar’
msItem.note: Latin and French. As pr. Munimenta I.373–85. Fol. 71r (= p. 379, ‘De ordenaunce des pessoners’), heading, Ceste chose fu crie a Londres le venderdi prochein deuant la Pentecoust en lan du regne le Roi Edward xviij. Here followed by eight further items concerning nets: item ilia vne autre manere de Reys Cotnet Shouenet Kideles &c.
Notes of customs. French.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt custume pontis Lond’
msItem.note: Largely as pr. Munimenta I.234–238 (l. 4, ‘par estraunge, iiii deniers’)

msItem.incipit: La karke de Greyne qe peise
msItem.note: Various customs, largely as pr. Munimenta I.230–234.

msItem.incipit: De vne liure de leyn au foreyn
msItem.note: As pr. Munimenta I.246–8.

msItem.finalRubric: Et fet a remembrer qen cest liure nad nule mencioun de la Ryue pur ceo qe les Citeyns de Loundres ont mesmes al Ryue a ferme del Counte de Cornewaille et a li responent de la ferme. Expliciunt

msItem.note: Note on the word hallmote.
msItem.incipit: Memorandum quod halimotus quem nos moderni dicimus halimot
msItem.explicit: debet intelligi per antiquam consuetudinem iste articulus

msItem.rubric: Les chapitres qi deuient estre ditz as pestours
msItem.incipit: Deux pains .v. et iiij. deuient estre fait a vendre
msItem.explicit: faet gre a son primer mestre
msItem.note: French.
Memorandum on a kidell of the abbot of Lesnes.
As cal. Letter-Bk. A, fol. 91.

msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo qualiter procedendum est in assisis de edificiis inter vicinos Ciuitatis London’
msItem.note: Assize of Buildings, 1189, as pr. Munimenta I.319–332.

msItem.rubric: De aliquibus maximis libertatibus Ciuitatis London’
msItem.note: Ten articles; as summarized Munimenta I.673, referring to Liber Horn, fol. 230.

msItem.rubric: Carta facta Ciuibus London’ de Ripa Regine
msItem.note: Charter-inspeximus of Henry III, 25 Feb. 1247, cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 15, pr. Munimenta II.i.46–7.

msItem.rubric: Ces sount les Chapitres de les assises et establisemenz des audermanz que sont a mustrer en plein Wardemotes
msItem.incipit: Qe la pes deu et la pes nostre seignur le Roi soit fermement garde
msItem.explicit: fet damage en temps de este

msItem.rubric: De serianz et atturnez
msItem.note: Largely as pr. Munimenta II.i.280–2, text here a little fuller.

msItem.rubric: Ces sount les vsages et les franchises de Loundres les queux Richer de Refham Meire de Loundres par comandement le Roy fist crier par my Loundres
msItem.incipit: En primes qe la pees dieu et la pees nostre seignur le roi soit bien garde et meintenue

msItem.rubric: Ista allocacio libertatis London’ facta fuit coram domino Rege apud Westm’ termino sancti Hillarii ano regni Regis Edwardi filii regis Edwardi sexto. Rotulo .lxxix.
msItem.note: Pleadings in Petronilla who was the wife of Robert de Breme of Lapworth vs. Henry de Brandeston and Henry le Webner.

msItem.rubric: Adhuc de libertatibus London’
msItem.incipit: Nul homme qest en la franchise
msItem.note: Latin and French; cf. Munimenta I.675–8 (referring to Liber Horn, fols. 255–6); ibid. I.109–110, 112 (c. 49)-117 (c. 61).

msItem.rubric: Quomodo Ciues London’ cognouerunt se esse talliabiles et hoc est contra eorum antiquam libertatem
msItem.note: Writ of Henry III to the barons of the exchequer, and proceedings, 39 Henry III
Ordinance of 1300 concerning curriers, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 79. French.
Miscellaneous ordinances concerning trades
Largely as pr. Munimenta I.261 (‘Et pur ceo qascuns achatours’) - 276 (‘soient puniz’). French.

msItem.rubric: Breve et ordinacio fullonum
msItem.note: Writ, 1298, and proceedings, largely as cal. Letter-Bk. C, pp. 51–3 (fuller) and pr. Munimenta II.i.127–9. Latin and French.

msItem.rubric: Carta Regis Henrici tercij de Gilda Telariorum
msItem.note: 1243, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 55, pr. Munimenta II.i.48, here with names of witnesses.

msItem.rubric: Carta Gilde Telariorum
msItem.note: Charter of King John, 20 March 1202, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 55, witnesses here abbreviated.

msItem.rubric: Electio Telariorum
msItem.note: 1300, as cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 56, pr. Munimenta II.i.126, names of bailiffs at end omitted.

msItem.rubric: Ordinaciones Telariorum
msItem.note: As cal. Letter-Bk. C, p. 60, pr. Munimenta II.i.121–6. French.
Legal and other memoranda, added in several hands, mid-fourteenth century; further additions, fols. 99v-100r, late fourteenth century.
Pleas in Hustings, 16 June 1320, as cal. Letter-Bk. E, p. 133
Pleas in Hustings, Monday, St Edmund king, 14 Edward III.
Pleas in Hustings, Monday after St Edmund king, 18 Edward III.
Plea in the sheriff's court (?), Friday, morrow of Hilary, 18 Edward III.
Letters patent of Edward III concerning the keepers of the change, 30 Sept. 16 Edward III.

Proceedings in the Exchequer, Michaelmas 18 Edward III, against John Syward and John Aylesham, sheriffs, relating to the escape from Newgate gaol of Robert Nuytaundr' (?), followed by a memorandum on a similar case, 19 Edward III.
Pleas in Hustings, Monday after St Edmund bishop, 24 Henry VIII; 16th century addition.
Memorandum of 28 Sept. 19 Edw. III relating to the right of departing sheriffs to the wool custom (Letter-Bk F, pp. 133–4).
Proclamation relating to pulterers, Sat. before Palm Sunday, 19 Edward III (1345), and subsequent memorandum (Letter-Bk F, p. 123, names of aldermen here omitted).
Pleas in Hustings.
Fol. 97r: Mon. after St Dunstan, 13 Edward III.
Fol. 97r-v: Monday before St Barnabas, 13 Edw. III.
Fol. 97v: Monday before St Margaret, 13 Edw. III
Fol. 97v: Monday before Simon and Jude, 13 Edw. III
Fol. 97v-98r: Monday after St Edmund king, 13 Edw. III
Copies of royal writs. Fol. 98r-v: not dated. Fol. 98v-99r: 5 and 14 Feb. 14 [Edward III]. Fol. 99v: 28 Nov. 15 Edward III. Fol. 100r: 20 May 1 Edward III.
Added, late 14th century or early 15th century:
Letter from the mayor of Coventry to the mayor and bailiffs of Northampton, Friday after Hilary, 16 Richard II. French.
Memorandum concerning a lease in Northampton by John Tydenham, prior of St Andrew's, Northampton.
Note on a case in the London assize rolls, Friday after Annunciation, 7 Edward [?II].
Ordinances of Edward I (as above, fols. 63v-69v); pr. Munimenta I.280–88, ending imperfect at ‘et lours chars sur le’
Imperfect at end (catchword, fol. 104v, and cf. reference to now missing last folio of the book, fol. 100r).

As Ker pointed out (MMBL, I, 35), the sequence of material in this volume and in the Liber Memorandum (London Metropolitan Archives, COL/CS/01/003) agrees almost exactly with Liber Horn (London Metropolitan Archives, COL/CS/01/002), fols. 261r-264v, 281–369v, 375rv, 370–4v, 199v-219v, with the present volume further corresponding on fols. 72v-93r to Liber Horn, fols. 219v-232r, 251r-277r. The relationship between the three volumes needs further investigation, but it is not clear that any of the three was copied from any other.

supportDesc.extent: i (modern paper, conjoint with pastedown) + ii (16th-century paper) + 104 + i (16th-century paper) + i (modern paper, conjoint with pastedown) folios c. 230 160 Cropped, with occasional loss of text in the upper and outer margins.
supportDesc.collation: Remaining catchwords and visible thread suggest 1–13(8), but cannot be collated in detail. Catchwords fols. 96v, 104v.

layoutDesc.layout: Fols. 1–96v: 46 long lines. Ruled in leadpoint. Ruled space c. 195 c. 110 , with an additional outer column of c. 23 mm. for marginal headings. Bounding lines extending the full width of the page: a single line in the inner margin, a double line followed by a single line in the outer margin; a single line in the upper margin, a single line followed by a double line in the lower margin (Muzerelle 1–21/0–2/1–1/J). Layout varies for the additions on fols. 93r-96v.

handDesc.handNote: Fols. 1–93r: one hand writing a neat anglicana; headings in anglicana formata. Additions and marginalia in several hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1: 6-line historiated initial D with gold background depicting a king with orb and sceptre (?), badly damaged, extending into a partial border. (Pächt and Alexander iii. 599)
Fols. 1–93r: two-line coloured initials in alternating red and blue, with contrasting penwork decoration in red and violet, extending into the border.

additions.p: Contemporary and later marginalia in Latin, French and English.

history.origin: 14th century, second quarter, with later additions English, London
history.provenance: Fols. 1–93r written after 1327 (fol. 6r) and probably before the date of the earliest additions, 1340.

In contrast to the Liber Memorandorum, this volume seems never to have belonged to the Corporation of London, and is not listed among the books in the custody of the Corporation c. 1470 (Hospitals, Towns, and the Professions, CMBLC 14, SH47). All the identifiable later owners seem to be associated by membership of the Inner Temple.

T. Warley 1530, fol. 52r (cf Warley, fol. 27r; probably also his name, erased, fol. 46v; memorandum by him, fol. 16v; addition in his hand, fol. 95v, referring to a plea in Hustings, 24 Henry VIII, in which he acted as executor of John Whaberley, goldsmith of London). Probably identifiable as Thomas Warley (II), fl. c. 1520–1557, on whom see J. Baker, The Men of Court 1440–1550, Selden Soc. (2012), II.1627.

liber Johannis Croke ex Dono Lucae Norton, 17th century, fol. iii verso (dates 20 May 1601, 24 Jan. 1619); perhaps Luke Norton of Sharpenhoe (d. 1630, Inner Temple 1583 onwards) and John Croke of Holborn, etc., judge and speaker of the Commons (d. 1620).
Liber V. Croke, 17th century, fol. iii verso, perhaps Unton Croke (1593–1671), son of Sir John.
MS. Rob Baylis Eq. aur. senatoris Londinensis, early 18th century, fol. ii: Sir Robert Baylis (1673–1748), alderman of London from 1719, knighted 1727 (see History of Parliament).

His sale, 20 Nov. 1749 and eleven following evenings: libri miscellanei, Gr. Lat. Quarto, no. 229 (Bibliotheca elegans. A catalogue of the entire and valuable library of Sir Robert Baylis, Knt. and Alderman, p. 27).
history.acquisition: Bequeathed by him to the Bodleian.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, March 2019. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (W. D. Macray, Catalogi codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecæ Bodleianæ...viri munificentissimi Ricardi Rawlinson, J.C.D., codicum...complectens, Quarto Catalogues V, 5 fascicles, 1862–1900). Summary Catalogue, Vol. 3, p. 200 Quarto Catalogue, Col. 616 Quarto Catalogue, Cols. 617–8

listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, III (1973), no. 599
